title: Rear Brake Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Seat and Battery - remove DD2; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DF4; DG4
Disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first (see

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DG4; DF4; DEX; DD2; DF2; DE2; DF; DE

body.body: Remove the right hand side panel - D34; DD4; DB; DBX; DD2; DE; DE2; DP; DP3; DPA; DU; DUY; DZ
Remove the right hand side panel (see

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D34; DD4; DD2; DP3; DE2; DE; DUY; DU; DZ; DPA; DP; DBX; DB

body.body: Drain the fluid from the master cylinder by bleeding the system at the rear brake caliper until all fluid has been expelled.
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.

body.name: Rear Brake Res (side panel connectors DD2)

body.body: Disconnect the brake line from the rear master cylinder. Discard the sealing washers.
Note the routing of the brake switch harness for installation.
Remove the fixing and detach the brake line P-clip from the right hand control plate.
Remove the E-clip and clevis pin from the front footrest and remove the footrest from the control plate, noting the orientation of the spring for installation.
Remove the fixings and detach the right hand control plate from the frame.
Release the clip, and noting its orientation, remove the brake fluid reservoir and hose from the master cylinder.
Remove the clip and clevis pin at the lower end of the brake push rod.
Remove the two fixings and detach the rear brake master cylinder from the right hand control plate.

body.name: Rear brake master cylinder hose cjsi
